benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog - Retrieve the catalog as JSON

covered: Valid requests: TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04 and TC16 exercise successful retrieval (latest catalog, requestedDate, accountId, and combinations) and assert 200 + JSON array response.
Empty / Not found responses: TC05 and TC06 cover absence of any catalog and no-catalog-for-requestedDate -> 404 handling.
Query parameter validation: TC07 (invalid requestedDate), TC08 (invalid accountId), TC11 (unsupported params ignored), TC17 (min/max date) cover many parameter validation and combination scenarios.
Authorization: TC09 and TC10 verify missing and invalid authentication tokens (401 responses).
Response format & schema: TC01 and TC23 assert Content-Type application/json and TC23 explicitly requires validation against the API schema.
Error scenarios: TC07, TC08, TC05, TC06, TC09, TC10, TC14, TC15 and TC22 cover a broad set of error responses (400/422, 401, 404, 503, 504).
Performance & concurrency: TC12 and TC13 exercise large dataset performance and concurrent requests.
Large payload / truncation: TC18 ensures very large responses are returned and not truncated.
Security: TC15 checks handling of a SQL-injection-like payload in query parameters.
Stability & regression: TC19, TC20, TC21 cover regression, backward-compatibility and retry-after-transient-error recovery scenarios.
gaps: Pagination: No tests address pagination (page/limit, offsets, pagination metadata or headers) or how very large result sets should be paged; the guidelines explicitly call this out.
Caching behavior: No tests assert caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or conditional requests (If-None-Match -> 304).
Rate limiting / throttling: TC13 exercises concurrency but there are no tests that intentionally exceed rate limits to verify 429/Retry-After behavior.
500 Internal Server Error handling: No scenario simulates a server/DB crash to verify 500 and consistent error reporting.
403 Forbidden / fine-grained authorization: Tests cover missing/invalid auth (401) but not valid auth with insufficient privileges (403), e.g., access to another tenant/account.
Method restrictions: No tests assert that unsupported HTTP methods (POST/PUT/PATCH/DELETE) return proper 405 responses.
Error response consistency & headers: Error scenarios do not consistently assert error response Content-Type, a standard error schema (errorCode/message), or presence of helpful headers.
Content negotiation: No tests for Accept header handling or 406 Not Acceptable responses when client cannot accept application/json.
Date-time edge cases & timezone handling: Tests do not explicitly cover timezone offsets, DST transitions, or ambiguous date-time inputs (beyond invalid format).

Field-level schema validation coverage is limited: although TC23 requests schema validation, most success scenarios only assert "JSON array of Catalog objects" without checking required fields, types, or nested object correctness for each Catalog instance.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: if the API supports pagination, add tests for page/limit parameters, verify pagination metadata (total/pages), and ensure correctness when iterating pages; if it does not support pagination, document and test how very large responses are handled (streaming, timeouts).

Add caching tests: assert ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified headers; add conditional requests (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since) and verify 304 Not Modified behavior and that account/requestedDate variations produce separate cache keys when appropriate.
Add rate-limiting tests: craft burst requests to trigger throttling and assert 429 responses and Retry-After headers; include sustained high-rate tests to validate graceful degradation.
Simulate server failures: add tests that induce DB/service errors to verify 500 Internal Server Error behavior and ensure error responses follow a consistent JSON error schema and status codes.
Add authorization edge cases: test 403 scenarios (valid token but insufficient permissions or cross-tenant access), and test account-scoped access rules (account exists but user not authorized).
Test unsupported HTTP methods: ensure POST/PUT/PATCH/DELETE on this endpoint return 405 with appropriate Allow header.
Standardize error response assertions: require Content-Type application/json for errors and assert a canonical error schema (fields like code, message, details) across scenarios.
Expand date-time edge-case coverage: add tests for timezone offsets, leap-days, DST boundaries, and very large/small date-time values to validate requestedDate handling.

Increase schema assertions: extend TC23 into multiple tests that validate required fields, types, and nested structures in each Catalog object (plans, products, prices), and include negative tests for missing mandatory fields.
Add tenant/account edge-case tests: accountId exists but has no tenant-specific catalog, account is deleted/soft-deleted, account belongs to different tenant — verify correct 404/403 behavior.
